title: Coronavirus: GPs not told when patients removed from 'shielding lists'
description: This has caused confusion and anxiety among extremely vulnerable people staying at home.

title: Boy yearns to see seaman dad moored outside house
description: A father is unable to get off his ship to see his four-year-old son during lockdown.

title: 'Lockdown boredom led me to smoke more weed’
description: Reece had big plans for his time during lockdown but instead he has found himself smoking drugs.

title: Coronavirus: Bill Gates ‘microchip’ conspiracy theory and other vaccine claims fact-checked
description: Fact-checking vaccine claims - including ones about the ex-Microsoft boss and a dubious cow-dung trial.

title: Week in pictures: 23-29 May 2020
description: A selection of news photographs taken around the world this week.

title: 'Scorching-hot hacked computer burned my hand'
description: Student's computer overheated after it was hit with a "crypto-jacking" attack.

title: Coronavirus: Belgian zoo comes back to life from lockdown
description: After two months without visitors, Pairi Daiza is welcoming the public back, but in smaller numbers.

title: Remi Wolf on how she makes music videos in lockdown
description: How rising star Remi Wolf made the promotional video for her new track in the middle of the pandemic.

title: Coronavirus: What happens next?

title: DIY dentistry: What is safe to do to your own teeth?
description: How can you treat your own teeth while waiting to see a dentist?

title: What is it like being at school in South Korea?
description: Strict safety measures are in place, but more than 200 schools have been forced to close just days after they re-opened.

title: Coronavirus: Trump terminates US relationship with WHO
description: The president accuses the UN health agency of "failing" over its handling of the Covid-19 pandemic.

description: Tensions in Minneapolis did not start with the death of George Floyd. They've been years in the making.

title: Coronavirus: How safe is it to get on a plane?
description: Many airlines are planning to resume flying, but they first need to reduce the risks of Covid-19.

title: Coronavirus: Greece to open up in two weeks, but not to the UK
description: Tourists from 29 countries will be able to visit Greece from 15 June, but not travellers from the UK.

title: Coronavirus: What are the risks for children?
description: Children seem to be at low risk from the disease, but can they still spread it?

description: Millions unable to do their job due to coronavirus will have their wages paid by a new scheme.

title: Leicester boss Rodgers reveals he had coronavirus

title: Murray to play in 'Battle of Brits' tournament organised by brother Jamie
description: Andy Murray will play in a tournament organised by brother Jamie in June that will raise money for the NHS.

description: The US city sees a third night of unrest sparked by the death of George Floyd in police custody.

title: Twitter hides Trump tweet for 'glorifying violence'
description: For the first time, Twitter has hidden a tweet on the president's profile behind a warning.

title: Coronavirus: Dental practices to reopen from 8 June
description: Dental practices in England have been told they can reopen from Monday, 8 June.

title: Coronavirus: Scotland begins to ease out of lockdown
description: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon urges "caution" as people are allowed to meet friends and family again.

title: Premier League: Liverpool could seal title at neutral venue with six fixtures set to move
description: The game in which Liverpool could secure the Premier League title could be held at a neutral venue, says the national lead for football policing.

title: Coronavirus: Chancellor set to outline furlough scheme changes
description: The government is currently paying part of the wages of more than 8 million furloughed workers.

title: UK weather: Sunniest spring since records began
description: England is set to have its driest May in 124 years as some areas warn of drought conditions.

title: Uzma Khan: An actress assaulted, a jealous wife and a viral video in Pakistan
description: Uzma Khan was beaten by three rich women and their guards. Why is this not a headline in Pakistan?

title: Minneapolis unrest: CNN reporter arrested live on air
description: Omar Jimenez was reporting on protests in Minneapolis when he was detained by officers.

title: Islamic State: RAF carries out four air strikes in May
description: The Ministry of Defence says the strikes in Iraq on the Islamic State group all hit their targets.

title: Richard Sambrook to review BBC's social media use
description: The former director of global news at the BBC will examine online posts from programmes and staff.

title: 'Cannabis burned during worship' by ancient Israelites - study
description: Cannabis residues have been found on an altar in an ancient desert temple in Israel.

title: Robbie Williams to rejoin Take That for virtual gig
description: The old band are (almost all) back together for a charity event, broadcast from each of their homes.

title: Coronavirus: New mortgage holiday should affect credit record, says Nationwide boss
description: The UK's biggest building society says struggling applicants should be flagged to lenders.

title: George Floyd death: Minneapolis clashes run into third night
description: Images show how unrest spread in Minnesota after the death of George Floyd in police custody.

title: Teepee built at East Bergholt school to allow social distancing

description: England name 14 uncapped players in a group of 55 that have been asked to return to training in preparation for a revamped international summer.

description: The Williams Formula 1 team and wider company group are up for sale after posting a £13m loss last year.

title: Coronavirus: National Trust to reopen gardens and parks
description: Those who pre-book will be able to visit some sites in England and Northern Ireland from 3 June.

title: Cognac bottle, labelled one of world's oldest, sells for £118,000

title: Coronavirus: When will public toilets be reopened?
